citation.article-title: Heliobacillus mobilis, a peritrichously flagellated anoxyphototroph containing bacteriochlorophyll g.

p.s: Description of Heliobacillus mobilis sp. nov.
Gram-negative rod-shaped cells approx. 1 × 7-10 μm, but frequently longer; isolated from rice paddy soil.
Actively motile in young cultures by means of peritrichous flagella.
Strictly anaerobic: grows photoheterotrophically in synthetic media with biotin as a required growth factor; optimal temperature, 40-42°C.

Green coloration of cells due to the major photopigment, bacteriochlorophyll g; cells do not contain chromosomes or prominent intracytoplasmic membranes of the kind seen in purple photosynthetic bacteria.
